definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: The first wave of purchases was to arbitrage the difference between spot and futures prices.
sentences.chinese: 第一波购买行情是为了套取现货期货市场间的差价。

sentences.english: The detective was trying to winkle information out of her.
sentences.chinese: 侦探试图从她那儿套取信息。

definition: to obtain by impersonation/to falsely claim as one's own
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to entice/to lure/to scam/to hoodwink/to decoy
to scam/to set a trap/to set up a scheme to defraud people
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to shift (funds)/to (legitimately) take funds set aside for one purpose in order to use them for another/to embezzle/to misappropriate
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
